intro: Epilobium lanceolatum f. simplex, commonly known as the simple willow herb, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist habitats such as wet meadows, streambanks, and marshes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is distinguished by its simpler inflorescence structure compared to other forms of Epilobium lanceolatum.
